Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Minister Sat Kirin Kaur Khalsa, Sikh Dharma of New York, 220 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10001.


Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Weprin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Minister Sat Kirin Kaur Khalsa, Sikh Dharma of New York, 220 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10001.

Council Member Weprin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 8, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mark-Viverito.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Mark-Viverito moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 8, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Rudy Washington to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his re-appointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Rudy Washington, NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Charles D. McFaul to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Charles D. McFaul, NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Herbert Berman as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission and consider his designation as Chair.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Mr. Berman will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Herbert Berman, NYC Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Jamila Ponton Bragg as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.   If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Ponton Bragg will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Jamila Ponton Bragg, NYC  Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Lesley Horton as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.   If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Horton will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Lesley Horton, NYC Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Margaret Morton as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Morton will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Margaret Morton, NYC Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department  of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 28 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10014, Community Board 2, Application 20115241 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 28 Eighth Ave, Manhattan (20115241 TCM)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):                
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the  Council and Section 20-226(G) or Section 20-25 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 253 Tenth Avenue, New York, NY 10001, Community Board 4, Application 20105632 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café,  253 Tenth Ave, Manhattan (20105632 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Vallone:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-2269(g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 40-11 30th Avenue. Queens, NY 11103, Community Board 1, Application 20115286 TCQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 40-11 30th Ave, Queens (20115286 TCQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Dickens:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section  20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1 West 125th Street, New York, NY 10027, Community Board 10, Application 20115323 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 1 West 125th St, Manhattan (20115323 TCM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the purchase of New York state food.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Purchase of New York state food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to issue an annual report regarding hepatitis B and hepatitis C.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to issue an annual report regarding hepatitis B and hepatitis C.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the cleaning of liquid on a sidewalk, flagging or curbstone generated by trash placed curbside for collection and allowing the use of a hose to conduct such cleaning during times otherwise proscribed by such code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the cleaning of liquid on a sidewalk, flagging or curbstone generated by trash placed curbside for collection and allowing the use of a hose to conduct such cleaning during times otherwise proscribed by such code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all pedestrian crossings with countdown signals to be equipped with an audible pedestrian signal.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring all pedestrian crossings with countdown signals to be equipped with an audible pedestrian signal.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reuse of tableware at consumer self-service operations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Reuse of tableware at consumer self-service operations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the registration of landlords of multiple dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Registration of landlords of multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of information technology and telecommunications to post certain information regarding street closures and parking regulations on the internet.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOITT to post certain information regarding street closures and parking regulations on the internet.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the publication of information regarding street fairs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: The publication of information regarding street fairs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying the applicability of the noise control code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Clarifying the applicability of the noise control code.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to reinstate the privileges, formerly held by the Puerto Rican Resident Commissioner and other delegates, allowing them to vote on amendments and procedures in the Committee of the Whole.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Congress to reinstate the privileges, formerly held by the Puerto Rican Resident Commissioner and other delegates, allowing them to vote on amendments and procedures in the Committee of the Whole.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing packaging reduction guidelines for contractors with city agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Establishing packaging reduction guidelines for contractors with city agencies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the General Municipal Law to allow New York City to institute procurement preferences for the purchase of food originating within the New York region.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the General Municipal Law to allow NYC to institute procurement preferences for the purchase of food originating within the NY region.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact legislation that regulates the amount and type of packaging used to encase goods procured by the State and all localities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation that regulates the amount and type of packaging used to encase goods procured by the State and all localities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the purchase and use of etching pens.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Purchase and use of etching pens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the fluoridation of water.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Fluoridation of water.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to increase the punishment for endangering the welfare of a child by designating this crime as a felony.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increae the punishment for endangering the welfare of a child by designating this crime as a felony.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to make serial acts of public lewdness a class A misdemeanor offense, and to amend the Correction Law to include public lewdness as a registerable sex offense.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Make serial acts of public lewdness a class A misdemeanor offense, and to amend the Correction Law to include public lewdness as a registerable sex offense.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to reintroduce and pass legislation that would require ex-felons to be fully informed of their voting rights.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Reintroduce and pass legislation that would require ex-felons to be fully informed of their voting rights.

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Herbert Berman as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission and consider his designation as Chair.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Mr. Berman will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Herbert Berman, NYC Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Jamila Ponton Bragg as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.   If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Ponton Bragg will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Jamila Ponton Bragg, NYC  Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Lesley Horton as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.   If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Horton will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Lesley Horton, NYC Lobbying Commission

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Margaret Morton as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Morton will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
